hints.content: Let's count how many toddlers ran $96\text{ m}$.

Pedro ran $96\text{ m}$.

So, we place $1$ dot over $\greenE{96}$ on the number line.  

![](web+graphie://cdn.kastatic.org/ka-perseus-graphie/d1b9865295d5a7aa1573983e9b973ce050bdd085)
Now, let's graph the other measurements on the table.

Here is the completed line plot:

![](web+graphie://cdn.kastatic.org/ka-perseus-graphie/e7499030f283b8c7ff914765fd0e1da9ed8f1bc8)

question.content:
The Toddler Running Club runs each day.  Their parents are going to make a line plot of the data.  

Runner | Distance ($\text{m}$)
:-: | :-: | :-:
Enzo | $99$
Minli | $99$
Aurora | $97$
Pedro | $96$
Tony | $99$

**Graph the measurements from the table on the line plot.**   
*Click above the line plot to make dots for each of the measurements.*
